answerText: Miguel Angel Asturias[10] The second novel in that trilogy by Asturias is titled for a Pope of this color. A knight of this color challenges Gawain to a beheading contest in a Middle English poem.
heading: NASAT |2013 | 8 | 14 | Literature | World | College
subject: Literature
question: Question: The title crop is seen in a different light by natives and foreigners in this author's Men of Maize. For 10 points each: [10] Name this Guatemalan Nobel laureate who also wrote about the abuses of the United Fruit Company in a trilogy including Strong Wind and The Eyes of the Interred.
